in a way that is natural, often sudden, and not planned or forced: This story may prompt you to burst spontaneously into uncontrollable sobs.
More examplesFewer examplesThey gave him a mike, and he spontaneously interviewed everyone.My best friend, who doesn't have kids, always expects me to do things spontaneously with her.Hundreds of people could spontaneously appear at my house for a party.

science, medical
  specialized without any obvious outside cause: The liquid spontaneously ignited. Blood clots can occur spontaneously in some people. They found that fat contained some cells that spontaneously divided into more specialized cells.
More examplesFewer examplesNerve gases quickly affect the central nervous system. A person can't breathe, their eyes start blinking and their muscles move spontaneously.About 90% of patients with acute low back problems recover spontaneously within a month.Stem cells grown in petri dishes spontaneously try out new fates.
